author: Francisco-Gamino
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

```
$error.Clear()
$cmdlet = "Test-Enum"
$expectedSyntax = "Test-Enum [-TestMyEnum <MyEnum> {enumvalue1 | enumvalue2}]  [<CommonParameters>]"
$moduleName = "TestEnumWithNullable"
$modulesDir = Join-Path $env:TEMP ([Guid]::NewGuid().tostring())
$modulePath = Join-Path $modulesDir "$moduleName.dll"
if(!(Test-Path $modulesDir))
{
    mkdir $modulesDir | Out-Null
}
# generate test module
$binaryModule = @'
using System; 
using System.Collections.Generic; 
using System.Text; 
using System.Management.Automation; 
using System.Management.Automation.Runspaces; 
namespace TestEnumWithNullable
{
    public enum MyEnum
    {
        enumvalue1 = 1,
        enumvalue2 = 2
    }
    [Cmdlet("Test", "Enum")]
    public class TestEnum : Cmdlet
    {
        private Nullable<MyEnum> _TestMyEnum;
        [Parameter]
        public Nullable<MyEnum> TestMyEnum
        {
            get
            {
                return this._TestMyEnum;
            }
            set
            {
                this._TestMyEnum = value;
            }
        }

        protected override void ProcessRecord()
        {
            WriteObject("Test Enum with Nullable");   
        }
    }
}'@
Add-Type -TypeDefinition $binaryModule -OutputAssembly $modulePath -OutputType Library
Import-Module $modulePath
Get-Help Test-Enum
```
## Expected behavior
```
NAME
    Test-Enum
SYNTAX
    Test-Enum [-TestMyEnum <MyEnum> {enumvalue1 | enumvalue2}]  [<CommonParameters>]

ALIASES
    None

REMARKS
    None
```
## Actual behavior
```
NAME
    Test-Enum
SYNTAX
    Test-Enum [-TestMyEnum <MyEnum>]  [<CommonParameters>]

ALIASES
    None

REMARKS
    None
```
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan - I thought you or I fixed this.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
@Francisco-Gamino I cannot seem to repro it. Can you still repro?

```Powershell
PS D:\OpenPowershell\aditya\platyPS\test\Pester> Get-Help Test-Enum

NAME
    Test-Enum

SYNTAX
    Test-Enum [-TestMyEnum {enumvalue1 | enumvalue2}]  [<CommonParameters>]


ALIASES
    None


REMARKS
    None



PS D:\OpenPowershell\aditya\platyPS\test\Pester>

PS D:\OpenPowershell\aditya\platyPS\test\Pester> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
CLRVersion
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.14-47-gf2b9f7d5abc5591c9e797645fb9379e5a8d608bd-dirty
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1

```

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: The output is missing the type of the enum ```<MyEnum>```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: We don't put `ValidateSet` values in the help either. Given that tab-completion works for Enums already, this is an enhancement we're moving out to 6.1.0.

title: Get-Help doesn't show all possible values for a Nullable enum parameter type when used on a cmdlet
